content:
Diagnosis
	1. WHO Grade III rhabdoid meningioma with BAP1 loss
	   Initial diagnosis January 2023
	   Progressive disease with bone metastases

	2. Steroid-induced diabetes

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2023 - Subtotal resection of right frontal meningioma
	12 May 2023 - Second debulking procedure for local recurrence

	Radiotherapy
	1. March 2023 - Post-operative radiotherapy 60Gy in 30 fractions
	2. August 2023 - Palliative radiotherapy to T4-T6 metastases 20Gy in 5 fractions

	Chemotherapy
	Bevacizumab commenced September 2023, discontinued December 2023 due to disease progression

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible

	Current disease status
	Progressive intracranial and extracranial disease

	Current issues
	1. Increasing headaches and confusion
	2. Progressive thoracic spine pain
	3. Right-sided weakness

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] attended today's clinic with his wife and daughter. Unfortunately, his condition has deteriorated significantly over the past three weeks. His headaches have worsened despite increasing dexamethasone to 8mg twice daily. He is experiencing intermittent confusion and his right-sided weakness has progressed, now requiring a wheelchair for mobility. His performance status has declined to ECOG 3.

The most recent MRI brain (15 March 2024) shows significant progression of intracranial disease with new satellite lesions and increasing mass effect. CT spine confirms progression of thoracic vertebral metastases with new T8 involvement. Blood tests show worsening renal function with eGFR 38.

I have had a detailed discussion with [redacted name] and his family about disease progression and poor prognosis. We agreed to focus on symptom control and quality of life. I have explained that further systemic treatment is unlikely to be beneficial given his declining performance status.

	Further investigations
	None planned

	Medication changes
	1. Increased dexamethasone to 12mg daily in divided doses
	2. Added pregabalin 75mg twice daily for neuropathic pain

	Follow up
	1. Urgent referral to palliative care team
	2. Weekly review by neuro-oncology nurse specialist
	3. Next oncology review in 2 weeks or sooner if needed

	Required GP actions
	1. Please monitor steroid-induced diabetes
	2. Consider prophylactic antibiotics if neutrophils fall below 1.0

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed disease progression and transition to palliative approach. Family aware of poor prognosis.
